poem:
Title: The Gambler's Play

Raven in the dawn, cawing inaudibly,
their voices, two pebbles skipping on a stagnant pond.
Echoing the same beat, a man steeled against silence,
flips his coin of power, heads or tails of democracy.
Eighty-eight shadows loom, the echoes grow louder,
yet still, the raven crows, undeterred and unmoving.
